Arabic with unambiguous clarity, as Ibn al-Asha‘ath did, according to what Ibn Abi Usaibia narrated.
Their commentaries on the original texts testify to their precise understanding of colloquial expressions and terminologies
that are common in
the source language. However, some translators, in contrast, adhered to a literal translation approach.
The differences in linguistic structures and the lack of equivalence in terms often led to ambiguity in the translations
